Ata Ul Haleem

Bioinformatician | Data Scientist | Researcher

Background

I'm a bioinformatician with a passion for translating complex biological questions into computational solutions. My work bridges the gap between biology, statistics, and software engineering to uncover insights from genomic data.

PhD in Computational Biology

University of Bioinformatics

2020-2024

Focused on developing novel algorithms for single-cell RNA sequencing analysis.

MSc in Data Science

Tech Institute

2018-2020

Specialized in machine learning applications for biological datasets.

Research Interests

Genomic Data Analysis

Developing pipelines for NGS data processing and interpretation

Reproducible Research

Creating scalable, documented workflows using Snakemake/Nextflow

Machine Learning in Biology

Applying ML techniques to predict gene function and interactions

Achievements

  • Published 8 papers in peer-reviewed journals (Bioinformatics, NAR, Genome Biology)
  • Contributed to 3 open-source bioinformatics projects
  • Developed pipelines used by 50+ research labs worldwide
  • Mentored 10+ junior bioinformaticians
